title.rendered: Will Team India continue winning triumphs?

content.rendered:
Team India will face Bangladesh in the 4th group stage of the 2022 T20 World Cup. The match will take place on Wednesday 2nd November at the Adelaide Oval. Both teams must win their next match at any cost, as a loss will affect their qualification for the next round.

Meanwhile, the weather is also expected to play an important role in the competition. Luckily, Team India’s match has not been interrupted by rain so far, but reports say it could ruin the Men in Blue when they take on Bangladesh in Adelaide.

There is a 60% chance of rain the night before the game. According to Accuweather, the weather is expected to be cool at the start of the match with over 70% cloud cover. Rain is forecast for 8pm and 11 pm. With both teams now tied on points, viewers hope the weather doesn’t spoil Wednesday’s exciting competition.

Meanwhile, Team India head coach Rahul Dravid said that he will continue to play his part in the tournament. backed up India’s opener KL Rahul, who is experiencing a weak patch “We fully supported KL Rahul with our words and actions,” Dravid said in the press before the game.

Dravid emphasized that Rahul is a great player and, along with skipper Rohit Sharma, is confident in his starting batsman.

The Australian Bureau of Meteorology says the forecast for Wednesday is cloudy with a medium chance (60%) of showers most likely, most likely in the evening, and winds from the southwest at 20-30mph. km.

KL Rahul is a great player. I am sure he will come back stronger. A situation like this poses a challenge for the world opener. I have no doubts, I know how much impact KL Rahul can make.

Read more: Brazil is the hot favorite for Qatar
